intro: Paepalanthus mollis var. itambeensis, commonly known as the Itambeensis Puya, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Peru. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense, woolly coating. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences that can reach several feet in height, featuring vibrant red and orange bracts. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
